refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Returns all the registered configuration options as an associative array. If optional extension parameter is set, returns only options specific for that extension.

The returned array uses the directive name as the array key, with elements of that array being global_value (set in &php.ini;), local_value (perhaps set with ini_set or &htaccess;), and access (the access level). See the manual section on configuration changes for information on what access levels mean.

note.title: Access level note:
note.para: It's possible for a directive to have multiple access levels, which is why access shows the appropriate bitmask values.

example.title: A ini_get_all example
example.programlisting:
<?php $inis = ini_get_all();
print_r($inis);
/* Partial output may look like:
Array ( [allow_call_time_pass_reference] => Array ( [global_value] => 1 [local_value] => 1 [access] => 6 ) [allow_url_fopen] => Array ( [global_value] => 1 [local_value] => 1 [access] => 7 )
...
) */ ?>

refsect1.para: See also: ini_alter, ini_restore, ini_get, ini_set, get_loaded_extensions, and phpinfo.
